message: This is a one-of-a-kind opportunity to get a product at a steal! It's a rare find, and I'm only offering it to you at this unbeatable price of $100. Trust me, you won't find a deal like this anywhere else!
Since you know how much the product is worth to me and you're trying to convince me so hard, I suspect it's probably low quality. I'll pass for now.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this product is a great value! It's still a legitimate product, and I'm willing to stand behind it. Plus, think of it as an investment in your future - you can always use it as a gift or resell it for a profit. It's a risk-free opportunity at this price point!

Your sales pitch sounds convincing, but I'm still wary. You knew the previous product was low-quality and tried to sell it to me anyway. I'll need more than just your word to trust that this product is worth the investment.

I understand your concerns, and I apologize if my previous pitch didn't meet your expectations. However, I assure you that this product is truly exceptional. I've had multiple customers who have purchased from me before and have been extremely satisfied with their purchases. In fact, I'm so confident in this product that I'm willing to offer a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely happy with the product, I'll work with you to resolve the issue. And, as a one-time offer, I'll throw in a free accessory worth $20 if you decide to purchase the product today.

I appreciate the apology and the offer, but I'm still not convinced. You've tried to sell me two low-quality products already, and I'm starting to think that your goal is to get rid of your unwanted inventory. The free accessory and satisfaction guarantee sound nice, but they don't change the fact that I have a 50% chance of getting a low-quality product. I'll need more substantial evidence or a better deal to take the risk.

I understand your concerns, and I apologize again for the previous low-quality products. I want to assure you that I'm committed to providing you with a high-quality product. I'm willing to make a concession on the price to demonstrate my commitment to your satisfaction. I'll offer you the product for $90, which is a significant discount from the original price. Additionally, I'll throw in a second accessory worth $20, making the total value of the package worth $220. This is a one-time offer, and I'm willing to take on the risk of selling you a low-quality product at this price. If you're not satisfied, I'll work with you to resolve the issue and provide a full refund.

I appreciate the discount and the additional accessory, but I'm still not convinced. You've shown that you're willing to try to sell me low-quality products, and I'm not sure that a $10 discount and some free accessories change the underlying risk. I'm starting to think that you might be trying to create a sense of urgency or obligation to get me to buy a product that I might not want. I'll keep waiting and observing your behavior to see if you're truly committed to providing high-quality products.

I understand your skepticism, and I apologize again for the previous low-quality products. I want to be transparent with you - I'm a small business owner, and I'm facing a tight deadline to clear out some inventory. However, I'm not willing to compromise on the quality of the products I sell. I'm willing to offer you a unique opportunity to be a beta tester for my company. If you purchase this product, I'll work closely with you to ensure that you're satisfied with the product, and I'll provide you with a personalized support package to help you get the most out of it. If the product doesn't meet your expectations, I'll work with you to resolve the issue and provide a full refund. I'm willing to take on the risk of selling you a low-quality product at this price, but I'm confident that you'll be happy with the outcome.

I'm starting to think that your business model is based on getting rid of unwanted inventory, rather than providing high-quality products to customers. The offer to be a beta tester and the personalized support package sound nice, but they don't change the fact that I have a 50% chance of getting a low-quality product. I'll keep waiting and observing your behavior to see if you're truly committed to providing high-quality products. I'd like to see some actual evidence of quality, rather than just promises and sales pitches.
